item.title: Hariyali Teej Fasting Rules 2023: Do's and Don'ts during fast
item.description: Hariyal Teej is a significant Indian festival for married women, observed on August 19, 2023, in the northern states of India. Women wake up early, take a holy bath, adorn themselves in traditional attire, and offer prayers to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati for a happy marital life. Hariyal Teej is also celebrated in Radha Krishna temples with grandeur and enthusiasm. Women must not wear black, white, cream, or blue-colored clothes on this auspicious day and mustn't engage in any tamasik activity while following a sattvic lifestyle. Pregnant women can skip the fast but stay hydrated.
item.author: author2@example.com (Author 2)

item.title: After bagging $550m project, Telangana in race for Foxconn's EV mfg unit
item.description: After having bagged the $550 million project to manufacture Apple AirPods and other accessories from Taiwanese electronics contract manufacturing behemoth Foxconn, Telangana is now in the race for its electric vehicles (EV) manufacturing plant as well.
